page.title: 03Lomans Farm
page.content: {Farm - General.} This small dairy farm in Broadhempston with 24 Guernsey cows is run by Mr. Helley alone except at hay making when he has help. He rents the 48 acres and the bungalow from Devon County Council. He has 30 acres used for grazing, 5 acres for barley and 2 acres for fodder beet, but 1 field and a cider apple orchard are not in our survey area. The cows on average are ten years old and produce about 270 litres daily. They are milked twice a day at 7am and 5pm. Mr. Helley has a tractor and accessories. He has a modern parlour which can milk 3 cows at a time and a bulk refrigerated tank. {Future.} The EEC quotas have bothered him and at the moment his hopes are not very good.
